The Prison Ship Martyrs Monument
In memory of 11,500 Patriotic Americans Sailors and
Soldiers who endured untold suffering And Ded Cn
the British Prison Ships Anchored in Wallabut DDuring
the Revolutionary War 1776.1782
heir Remains Lie Buried in the Crypt at the base of
This Honument which was Dedicated on Nov. 1 - 1908
from the bronze plaque attached to the monument

704416f-a.title: Brooklyn: Fort Greene Park.
704416f-a.text:
Fort Greene Park (Brooklyn): Viewing north across
the park toward Myrtle Avenue (''ET thereon) and St. Ed-
wards Street. In the distsnce is the Lower Manhattan
skyline; in the left background, several Brooklyn sky-
scrapers.
View 2 shows the Prison Ship Martyrs Monument.
April 27, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
